instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521 - stuck at 5v after plugged into external display
threads.message:
This one had no liquid damage, but was plugged in and powered by an external monitor before it fried. I replaced one of the CD32 chips as nothing was coming up on amp meter on that one port. then i got the 5V back on that port. Just in case replaced both of them in case one was causing the no 20V

scanned the board and saw that u8210 was fried, replaced that
then i did some more checking and realised f6700 was blown too so replaced that as well. still no difference 

I then saw that pp3v3_G3S was only 10ohms from to ground. I injected 3V and saw that u8210 was lit up on thermal. removed that but still had 500ma short on that line. I then saw that there's a small amount of heat coming from under WIFI chip 

this board is a nightmare...

threads.title: 820-01521 - stuck at 5v after plugged into external display
threads.message:
Seems that board is trash.
Let it more time under voltage injection and confirm if wifi chip is the culprit.
Also disconnect J6700.
